title: Laura Bridgeman, A Pioneer 50 Years Before Helen Keller
teaser: What Is Visible imagines the life of Laura Bridgman, the first blind and deaf person to learn language, years before the more famous Helen Keller. NPR's Scott Simon speaks with author Kimberly Elkins.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
